de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.sortable

Interface ListSortingListener<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the observed adapter's underlying data

    public interface ListSortingListener<DataType>
    Defines the interface, all listeners, which should be notified when the underlying data of a ListAdapter have been sorted, must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onSorted(ListAdapter<DataType> adapter, java.util.Collection<DataType> sortedItems, Order order, java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
      The method, which is invoked, when the adapter's items have been sorted.

    • Method Detail

      • onSorted

        void onSorted(@NonNull
              ListAdapter<DataType> adapter,
              @NonNull
              java.util.Collection<DataType> sortedItems,
              @NonNull
              Order order,
              @Nullable
              java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
        The method, which is invoked, when the adapter's items have been sorted.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The observed adapters as an instance of the type ListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        sortedItems - A collection, which contains the adapter's sorted items, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if the adapter does not contain any items
        order - The order, which has been used to sort the adapter's items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING
        comparator - The comparator, which has been used to compare the single items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the items' implementation of the type Comparable has been used instead
